title: Why prosecutors want a protective order in the criminal case against Trump
description: The order could bar Trump from improperly using any evidence shared with the defense team, such as witness statements.

title: 'Barbie' is the only billion-dollar blockbuster solely directed by a woman
description: Greta Gerwig's film joins a high-grossing list of mostly male-directed movies, most of them with men leading the casts.

title: Musk vows to pay legal costs for users who get in trouble at work for their tweets
description: Elon Musk said X, formerly known as Twitter, said there is "no limit" on how much the company is willing to pay.

title: The mysterious story of Connie Converse, the singer-songwriter who vanished
description: The artist quit music in the early '60s, then later disappeared so completely even her family didn't know where she'd gone. Now, an album of her songs — as she wanted them heard — is coming out.

title: Knocked out. Sweden bounces top-ranked U.S. out of the Women's World Cup in penalties
description: It was the earliest tournament exit for the two-time defending champions. The U.S. has not looked as sharp or dominant at the Women's World Cup as questions about tactics and lineups have swirled.

title: A train derailment has killed at least 15 and injured 50 in southern Pakistan
description: At least 15 passengers were killed and 50 more injured when a train derailed near the Pakistani town of Nawabshah in southern Sindh province, officials said Sunday.

title: They wanted a Bollywood ending, not an arranged marriage. Their escape came at a cost
description: More than 90% of Indians have arranged marriages, and polls show most are happy with that system. But for couples who want to follow their hearts, the risks can be severe.

title: This writer shares the right (and wrong) ways to honor Indigenous spirituality
description: Sometimes we find belonging in the most unexpected places. And sometimes, we find it buried deep in our own histories — in our own family legacies, as Patty Krawec did.

title: What the U.S. could learn from Japan about making healthy living easier
description: On a trip back to her parents' native country, a writer rediscovers what makes it different. The urban design, and a culture that values longevity, make good health come al lot more naturally.

title: Zelenskyy says bomb hit blood transfusion center, while shelling kills 3 overnight
description: Three people have died during a night of air strikes and intense shelling across Ukraine, officials said Sunday, as Kyiv's military exchanged fire with Russian occupation forces.

title: Shooting kills 2 men and a woman and wounds 2 others in Washington D.C.
description: A shooting on a street in the nation's capital left three people dead and two others hospitalized Saturday night, police said.

title: Some states are trying to boost youth voter registration. Here's what they're doing
description: More states are adopting policies to increase voter registration, including for young people. Those policies include automatic voter registration and pre-registration before age 18.

title: Where did 20,000 Jews hide from the Holocaust? In Shanghai
description: An exhibit in New York explores a little-known chapter of World War II.

title: Simone Biles dominates the US Classic in return to gymnastics after 2-year break
description: Confidence growing with every rotation, Biles soared to victory in her first meet since the Tokyo Games. Her all-around score of 59.100 was five points better than runner-up Leann Wong.

title: Philippines claims Chinese coast guard used water cannon on a boat in disputed sea
description: The Philippine military on Sunday condemned a Chinese coast guard ship's "excessive and offensive" use of a water cannon to block a supply boat from delivering new troops, food, water and fuel.
